meanings.definition: To give a slight involuntary grimace or shrinking movement due to pain or distress.
meanings.sent1: She would wince whenever the cold wind blew against her face.
meanings.sent2: He will wince if you touch his bruised arm.
meanings.sent3: The puppy would wince comically whenever it heard a loud noise.
meanings.sent4: The old man's face would wince in pain with every step he took.
meanings.sent5: The child's loud scream made her wince in surprise.

meanings.definition: A slight grimace or shrinking movement caused by pain or distress.
meanings.sent1: Her wince was barely noticeable as she tried to hide her pain.
meanings.sent2: He couldn't help but let out a small wince when the needle pricked his skin.
meanings.sent3: The comedian's exaggerated wince made the audience burst into laughter.
meanings.sent4: The wince on her face revealed the intensity of her discomfort.
meanings.sent5: His sudden wince caught the attention of everyone in the room.
